brief_summary.textblock:
This is a national, non interventional, prospective study performed in the general practice
      setting.

      The study has been designed :

        -  to assess the level of concordance between patients' cardiovascular risk perception and
           the cardiovascular risk evaluated by the physicians,

        -  and to evaluate the impact of patients' exposure to a medical information leaflet on
           patients' cardiovascular risk perception.

clinical_study.brief_title: Level of Concordance Between Patients Perception and Physicians Evaluation of Cardiovascular Risk

detailed_description.textblock:
LEVEL OF CONCORDANCE BETWEEN PATIENTS PERCEPTION AND PHYSICIANS EVALUATION OF CARDIOVASCULAR
      RISK

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Currently in primary prevention for a cardiovascular event (patient with no known
             history of acute cardiovascular or cerebrovascular event)

          -  Usually treated by the GP

          -  Having signed the information and consent form

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient with a pathologic vascular ultrasound exam (atheromatous plaque or stenosis)

          -  Patient unable to read and complete the study documentation

study_pop.textblock:
All adults aged 50 and over who :

          -  are currently in primary prevention for a cardiovascular event,

          -  are usually treated by the general practitioner,

          -  and have a medical visit during the study period.

clinical_study.official_title: Level of Concordance Between Patients Perception and Physicians Evaluation of Cardiovascular Risk

primary_outcome.measure: Cardiovascular risk perceived by patients (before reading the Medical Information Leaflet)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiovascular risks perceived by patients before and after reading the Medical Information Leaflet
Actual cardiovascular risk calculated using SCORE
Characteristics of patients whose self-evaluation of their CVR is concordant with their actual CVR
Characteristics of patients whose self-evaluation of their CVR is discordant with their actual CVR
Risk factors considered by patients in self-assessing their CVR

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
